author: @wibw
title: Common household product identified as cause of home explosion in Maine neighborhood, officials say
text: Common household product identified as cause of home explosion in Maine neighborhood, officials say SINCLAIR, Maine ( [WAGM](https://www.wagmtv.com/2024/08/14/propane-explosion-sinclair-highlights-dangers-safety-precautions/)/Gray News) - Officials said a product many people use was the cause of an explosion that took place in Maine on Saturday. The Maine Fire Marshal‚Äôs Office said the explosion in Sinclair was caused by propane, with the gas igniting and leading to mass destruction in a neighborhood. Barabra Deschaine said she was at home when her neighbor‚Äôs house exploded. ‚ÄúI heard a boom and I felt like the floor was going to cave into the cellar and the roof was going to fall in on top of me,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI looked out the window, and there was debris flying all over.‚Äù The Fire Marshal‚Äôs Office said the propane explosion sent debris across the street, into the nearby lakes and onto the rooftops of neighboring buildings. Deschaine‚Äôs home was damaged when debris from the explosion blew through the walls of the garage. Windows were blown out in other neighboring buildings. Another residence caught fire before it was destroyed. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre fortunate that so many fire departments came to help because it could have been a lot worse,‚Äù Deschaine said. Propane is a gas people commonly use and have in their homes. Although it is used daily, it can be dangerous if used incorrectly. Propane leaks can happen for many reasons, including valves left open, old tanks used, or pressure changes, among other reasons. When a leak happens, the gas can give off a distinct smell. However, even with the distinct smell, North Lakes Deputy Fire Chief Derrick Ouellette said the gas may not be noticed. ‚ÄúPropane is heavier in the air so it tends to lie in low places so sometimes it is hard to detect,‚Äù he said. Ouellette said there are other ways to watch for a propane leak if the smell cannot be detected. ‚ÄúIf your consumption has gone up and you haven‚Äôt used any more than usual, there‚Äôs a sign right there,‚Äù he said. He recommends that people who use propane also use propane gas detectors as a precaution. Copyright 2024 WAGM via Gray Local Media, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: SIPSE.com
title: Sistema el√©ctrico, en alerta por tercer d√≠a: ¬øhabr√° cortes de energ√≠a por ola de calor?
text: Sistema el√©ctrico, en alerta por tercer d√≠a: ¬øhabr√° cortes de energ√≠a por ola de calor? Existe la posibilidad de que se produzcan interrupciones en el suministro el√©ctrico en todo el territorio nacional, dado el estado de alerta en el que se encuentra el Sistema El√©ctrico Nacional. El Sistema El√©ctrico Mexicano enfrenta su tercer d√≠a de dificultades consecutivas, ya que el Centro Nacional de Control de Energ√≠a ha anunciado que ha entrado en Estado Operativo de Alerta. Esto significa que existe la posibilidad de que durante este jueves 9 de mayo se produzcan apagones en varios estados del pa√≠s. El Estado de Alerta Operativo se activ√≥ a las 15:02 horas, indicando que los niveles de reserva de energ√≠a se encuentran por debajo de lo normal en el Sistema El√©ctrico Nacional. Por segundo d√≠a consecutivo se reportan apagones en M√©xico‚Äî KL Videos (@KL_Videos) El Cenace declar√≥ estado de alerta del sistema interconectado nacional [#apagones] [#apag√≥n] [#M√©xico] [#ULTIMAHORA] [#ALERTA] [#URGENTE] [#BREAKING] [pic.twitter.com/3cvobKqNn6] [May 9, 2024] La tarde podr√≠a traer consigo un aumento en la demanda de energ√≠a, ya que las horas de mayor consumo suelen ser de 17:00 a 19:00 horas, lo que sugiere la posibilidad de apagones por tercer d√≠a consecutivo. Sin embargo, el Centro Nacional de Control de Energ√≠a ha asegurado que ya est√°n trabajando en las medidas operativas necesarias para abordar la situaci√≥n. El clima extremadamente caluroso que experimenta M√©xico esta semana es en gran medida responsable de la crisis en el sistema el√©ctrico, ya que ha provocado un aumento significativo en la demanda de electricidad, especialmente en las zonas con temperaturas m√°s altas. Para este jueves, los 32 estados del pa√≠s han estado bajo pron√≥stico de temperaturas m√°ximas superiores a los 30 grados, debido a la influencia de una segunda ola de calor generada por un sistema anticicl√≥nico que bloquea la entrada de lluvias. Alerta El√©ctrica en M√©xico: ¬øApagones Amenazan la Estabilidad del Pa√≠s? El Sistema El√©ctrico Nacional ha ingresado en un Estado Operativo de Alerta, con un nivel de reserva fluctuando entre el 3 y el 5 por ciento, por debajo del 6 por ciento considerado necesario para una operaci√≥n √≥ptima. La activaci√≥n de esta alerta antes del horario pico de consumo, que va de las 17:00 a las 19:00 horas, indica la posibilidad de transitar hacia un Estado Operativo de Emergencia. Este √∫ltimo se declara cuando el nivel de reserva cae por debajo del 3 por ciento, lo que podr√≠a desencadenar medidas m√°s estrictas para la gesti√≥n de la electricidad y evitar un colapso en el Sistema El√©ctrico Mexicano. La alerta sirve como un indicador temprano de una posible emergencia, como la ocurrida el pasado martes 7 de mayo, cuando el sistema el√©ctrico experiment√≥ una grave escasez de reservas, resultando en apagones generalizados. El mi√©rcoles 8, se mantuvo en estado de alerta, aunque tambi√©n se reportaron afectaciones en varias zonas del pa√≠s. üá≤üáΩ| √öLTIMA HORA: Apagones en diversas ciudades de M√©xico; sistema el√©ctrico entr√≥ en estado de emergencia.‚Äî Alerta Mundial (@AlertaMundoNews) [pic.twitter.com/lowMg6QkTC] [May 8, 2024] Con informaci√≥n de Reforma.

author: lavozdegalicia
title: Folgas a nivel nacional en Vestas E√≥lica tras romperse a negociaci√≥n do convenio
text:
O conflito laboral enqu√≠stase e de non haber acordo antes do 1 de abril, o persoal de cada centro de traballo rexerase polo convenio provincial
27 mar 2025 . Actualizado √° 11:51 h.A mesa negociadora do convenio a nivel espa√±ol de Vestas E√≥lica conclu√≠u o pasado martes sen acordo, e de non retomarse as conversaci√≥ns e haber un pacto nos pr√≥ximos d√≠as ‚Äîa data l√≠mites √© o primeiro de abril‚Äî o persoal pasar√° a rexerse polos convenios provinciais de cada centro de traballo. En Galicia ‚Äîcon sedes en Viveiro, A Estrada e A Coru√±a‚Äî e Asturias houbo varias xornadas de folga, na comunidade galega convocadas pola CIG, e CC.OO. organiza desde hoxe paros a nivel estatal.
O conflito laboral enquistouse. Os sindicatos consideran insuficiente a proposta da empresa, ¬´que √© de m√≠nimos e practicamente a mesma que fixo inicialmente, mentres que as centrais ofrecimos ata sete proposici√≥ns, e d√∫as unificadas¬ª, exp√≥n Jos√© Luis Carro, da CIG.
A nivel galego seguen as protestas. Este xoves haber√° de novo folga e o persoal galego concentrarase en Lugo e o luns est√° prevista unha protesta en Muras.
A CIG reclama frear ¬´a perda de poder adquisitivo e a perda de dereitos laborais¬ª do persoal e que a ¬´flexibilidade¬ª que Vestas pretende sexa ¬´voluntaria e ben remunerada¬ª.

author: blue News
title: Weather extremes will affect younger people considerably more than older people | blue News
text:
Study on global warming Weather extremes will affect younger people much more than older people
dpa
8.5.2025 - 00:00
Global warming is already affecting many people. In the future, there will be many more. A team of researchers presents new, alarming data on this.
No time? blue News summarizes for you
- People born after 2020 will suffer considerably from extreme weather events as a result of man-made climate change.
- This is true even if global warming could be kept to 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels. However, many researchers believe that meeting the 1.5 degree target is impossible anyway.
- This is the conclusion reached by a team led by Luke Grant from the Vrije Universiteit in Brussels in the scientific journal "Nature".
- Young people in particularly poor regions of the world are especially affected.
Those born in 2020 are more likely to experience extreme heatwaves than older people. Even if global warming could be kept to 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, around 52 percent of today's five-year-olds will be exposed to unprecedented heatwaves in their lifetime. For people born in 1960, the proportion is only 16 percent. This was reported by a team led by Luke Grant from the Vrije Universiteit in Brussels in the scientific journal "Nature".
As a result of climate change, there are measurably more and more severe extreme weather events. "Human influences have been identified in heatwaves, river floods, droughts, crop failures and certain aspects of forest fires and tropical cyclones," the team writes. So far, however, there has been little research into the extent to which individual people will be affected by such events. The researchers used climate models and demographic data, among other things, to predict the number of people who will be exposed to unprecedented levels of extreme events during their lifetime.
Grant and colleagues looked at three scenarios in which the Earth's average surface temperature in 2100 is 1.5 degrees, 2.5 degrees and 3.5 degrees higher than in pre-industrial times. They modeled what the different scenarios mean for people of different age groups.
Unprecedented exposure to heatwaves
Globally, 52 percent (around 62 million) of the people born in 2020 will be exposed to unprecedented heatwave stress in their lifetime in the 1.5 degree scenario. In the 3.5-degree scenario, this figure would rise to 92 percent (111 million). 29 percent would experience unprecedented exposure to crop failure and 14 percent to river flooding. If all pledges to combat global warming made by countries at the climate conferences are kept, the Earth will warm by 2.7 degrees by 2100, according to researchers.
If, instead, further cuts in greenhouse gases were to reduce global warming to 1.5 degrees in 2100, 613 million people born between 2003 and 2020 would be spared an unprecedented heatwave burden. In terms of crop failures, it would be 98 million, for river floods 64 million, for tropical cyclones 76 million, for droughts 26 million and for forest fires 17 million. "Our results call for a comprehensive and sustained reduction in greenhouse gas emissions to reduce the burden of climate change on today's younger generations," write the authors of the study.
Poor suffer the most
The team defines unprecedented exposure to extreme events as a probability of less than 1 in 10,000 that a person would experience the same exposure to the respective extreme events in a world without climate change. The authors also point out certain limitations of the study, such as the fact that factors such as internal migration were not taken into account.
Grant's team also found differences between people in poorer and wealthier countries. Rosanna Gualdi and Raya Muttarak from the Universit√† di Bologna (Italy) particularly emphasize this aspect in a commentary, also in "Nature": "Under a 2.7 degree warming scenario and current policies, people in the most socio-economically vulnerable group - those with high levels of poverty and low GDP - are consistently more exposed to heatwaves than other groups."

author: Kinsey Crowley
title: Editor believed Stormy Daniels Trump affair story, texts at trial show
text: Kinsey Crowley Aysha Bagchi Tabloid executive David Pecker [testified Thursday](/story/news/politics/2024/04/25/donald-trump-trial-live-updates-hush-money-case-news/73445686007/) that National Enquirer's top editor thought porn star Stormy Daniels' alleged sexual relationship with Donald Trump was a true story. On the seventh day of [Trump's trial](/story/news/politics/2024/04/25/donald-trump-trial-live-updates-hush-money-case-news/73445686007/) for 34 counts of falsifying business records, [Pecker,](/story/news/politics/elections/2024/04/23/david-pecker-national-enquirer-donald-trump/73428158007/) the former head of National Enquirer parent company American Media Inc., took the witness stand again. After testifying about the calls that led to the [publication paying former Playboy model](/story/news/politics/2023/03/31/karen-mcdougal-trump-hush-money/11572746002/) [Karen McDougal](/story/news/politics/elections/2024/04/22/who-is-karen-mcdougal/73410881007/) $150,000 for rights to her story, including an alleged affair with Trump, Pecker recounted internal discussions about Daniels. Trump denies Daniels' claim and that he broke any laws. The jury saw texts between Pecker and Dylan Howard, the editor in chief at the National Enquirer at the time. Pecker said Howard was unable to travel for the trial, but Thursday's testimony provided insight about what the publication thought about Daniels' story. Trump trial live updates: [David Pecker testifies about contract with Karen McDougal](/story/news/politics/2024/04/25/donald-trump-trial-live-updates-hush-money-case-news/73445686007/) 'This story is true:' Dylan Howard texted David Pecker about Stormy Daniels Howard texted Pecker that a woman wanted $120,000 for her story, according to texts shown to the jury at Trump's hush money trial. Pecker testified the woman he was referencing was Stormy Daniels. "I know the denials were made in the past ‚Äì but this story is true," Howard's texts shown to the jurors said, adding that the woman had other offers from "Mail" and "GMA." Pecker testified he refused to buy Stormy Daniels' story Pecker said he refused to buy Stormy Daniels' story. He texted Dylan Howard: "We can't pay 120k." Pecker explained on the stand that he was not a bank and had already paid hush money to [Dino Sajudin](/story/news/politics/elections/2024/04/23/david-pecker-national-enquirer-donald-trump/73428158007/) and Karen McDougal to help Trump. Sajudin was a doorman at Trump Tower who alleged Trump had a love child with a housekeeper in the building. [Pecker testified Tuesday](/story/news/politics/2024/04/23/trump-trial-live-updates-hush-money-case-news/73416679007/) that he did not believe Sajudin's story. Pecker also said he didn't want to be involved with a porn star. "Perhaps I call Michael and advise him and he can take it from there, and handle," Howard responded to Pecker, referring to Trump lawyer Michael Cohen, according to text messages displayed to the jury. After Pecker refused to buy Stormy Daniels' story, Cohen was upset and told Pecker the boss "would be furious with me," Pecker testified. Pecker still insisted he wouldn't go forward with purchasing it. Who is Stormy Daniels? [Stormy Daniels](/story/news/politics/2023/04/04/meet-stormy-daniels-woman-central-trumps-hush-money-probe/11600567002/), born Stephanie Clifford, is an adult film star. Daniels claims she had an affair with Trump in 2006, months after Melania Trump gave birth to Barron Trump. Cohen paid her $130,000 to stay quiet about the alleged affair ahead of the 2016 presidential election. Trump's subsequent reimbursement of Cohen, which he listed as legal expenses, is at the heart of prosecutors' allegation that the payments constituted an illegal campaign contribution by Cohen that Trump tried to hide by falsifying records. Who is David Pecker? [David Pecker](/story/news/politics/elections/2024/04/22/david-pecker-national-enquirer-donald-trump-trial/73409647007/), former CEO and president of American Media Inc., is the first witness on the stand at Trump's [Manhattan criminal trial](/story/news/politics/2024/04/25/donald-trump-trial-live-updates-hush-money-case-news/73445686007/). Pecker has testified that he was frequently in touch with Michael Cohen leading up to the 2016 election. Pecker said he promised to be "eyes and ears" about women selling stories about Trump, as part of a bigger effort to try to help his presidential campaign. The company was also fined [$187,500 by the FEC](/story/news/politics/2021/06/02/national-enquirer-publisher-pay-fine-helping-trump-campaign/7503861002/) for helping Trump's election, but the Justice Department granted Pecker immunity from prosecution. Contributing: Bart Jansen

author: @mint
title: Quadrantids meteor shower 2024: What is it? Best timing to watch. All you need to know | Mint
text:
The Quadrantid meteor shower, likely to be this year's first and strongest meteor shower, is expected to peak around 4 pm IST on 4 January through United States skies, according to In the Sky . Scientists say the Quadrantid meteor shower may bring up to 120 shooting stars every hour.
However, people can still witness a high rate of meteors between 4-5 January, and the shower will continue till 12 January, but chances of spotting meteors may drop drastically till then.
‚ÄúThe Quadrantids, which peak during early January each year, are considered to be one of the best annual meteor showers," Hindustan Times quoted the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) as explaining.
ALSO READ: Geminids meteor shower 2023: What is it? It's the best timing to watch. All you need to know
Best time to observe the shower in the US:
This year, the Quadrantids peak is expected to occur at 7.53 am Eastern Standard Time on 4 January. According to EarthSky , the meteor shower, activated on 26 December 2023, will continue till 16 January 2024.
The site also noted that the best time to witness the shower from North America will be at 4:53 am EST to dawn.
Apart from the Quadrantid shower, the three remarkable showers that occur annually are Lyrids, Leonids, and Ursids. These are known for their eccentric peaks.
NASA's recommendation on how to watch:
To get a rich experience of the Quadrantids, NASA recommended people observe them from a remote area during the nighttime and early morning hours.
Also, the space agency advised the enthusiasts to be adequately prepared for harsh winter conditions, as the moon will be 47 percent illuminated during the peak this time.
"Lie flat on your back with your feet facing northeast and look up, taking in as much of the sky as possible," NASA said. ‚ÄúIn less than 30 minutes in the dark, your eyes will adapt and you will begin to see meteors," it added.
Quadrantids Meteor Showers: All you need to know
Meteor showers are usually named after the constellation, but when it comes to Quadrantids, they beam out from the now-obsolete constellation of Quadrans Muralis. It is situated between the constellations of Bootes and Draco, placing it placed near the end of the handle of the Big Dipper in the northern sky, as per NASA. The Quadrantids are linked with asteroid 2003 EH1, which takes nearly 5.5 years to orbit around the Sun, reported Hindustan Times.
Due to this, the Quadrantid meteor shower that is believed to originate from the remains of dust and debris is exclusively seen in the Northern Hemisphere.

author: EFE
title: Una turba ataca a varias familias cristianas en Pakist√°n por una supuesta blasfemia
text: religi√≥n Una turba ataca a varias familias cristianas en Pakist√°n por una supuesta blasfemia Est√°n acusadas de haber quemado p√°ginas del sagrado Cor√°n, un delito en este pa√≠s de amplia mayor√≠a isl√°mica. Una multitud violenta atac√≥ a dos familias cristianas e intent√≥ incendiar sus viviendas en el noreste de [Pakist√°n](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/pakistan.html), acusadas de haber quemado p√°ginas del sagrado Cor√°n considerado blasfemia y un delito en este pa√≠s de amplia mayor√≠a isl√°mica, informaron este s√°bado fuentes oficiales. El incidente tuvo lugar en la ciudad de Sargodha, de la provincia de Punjab, donde un hombre residente de una colonia interrreligiosa "acusado de quemar p√°ginas del sagrado Cor√°n, lo que enfureci√≥ a la gente, confirm√≥ el portavoz de la policia de lala ciudad, Muhammed Abi. "La turba enfurecida tortur√≥ a varias personas mientras intentaban prender fuego a sus casas. La gente adem√°s rode√≥ la casa del ciudadano cristiano y quem√≥ sus pertenencias en la calle", relat√≥ el portavoz que asegur√≥ que la situaic√≥n est√° bajo control. El grupo violento bloque√≥ una carretera tratando de crear m√°s agitaci√≥n entre los habitantes del barrio Mujahib, donde conviven musulmanes y cristianos. Seg√∫n la polic√≠a, dos personas resultaron heridas y han sido trasladados al hospital. De momento se desconoce cu√°l fue el incidente que gener√≥ la ira de la comunidad, sin embargo un v√≠deo de una mujer no identificada circul√≥ ampliamente en redes sociales haciendo referencia a lo ocurrido. "Los ni√±os del vecindario regresaban de leer el Cor√°n por la ma√±ana, cuando una persona les quit√≥ el Cor√°n y le prendi√≥ fuego, tras lo cual los ni√±os regresaron a casa y se lo contaron a su madre", indica la mujer del video. Seg√∫n su relato, que no ha sido corroborada por las fuentes consultadas, la gente se reuni√≥ en el lugar y ella misma vio "que dos p√°ginas quemadas del Cor√°n yac√≠an separadas, despu√©s de lo cual la situaci√≥n se volvi√≥ violenta‚Äù. Ever wondered why every 'blasphemer' in Pakistan is set on fire after being lynched?‚Äî Pakistan Untold (@pakistan_untold) They want every blasphemer to end like a Hindu. You can't imagine the Hindu-hate people in this country have. [pic.twitter.com/kIcIeUgHRG] [May 25, 2024] La blasfemia es un delito en Pakist√°n desde la √©poca colonial brit√°nica y su castigo fue endurecido por el dictador Mohamed Zia-ul-Haq en los a√±os 1980, conllevando incluso la pena de muerte, aunque nunca nadie ha sido ejecutado por ello. El caso m√°s conocido en Pakist√°n de blasfemia contra un miembro de la minor√≠a cristiana fue el de Asia Bibi, sentenciada a muerte en 2010 aunque finalmente recibi√≥ la absoluci√≥n del Tribunal Supremo en 2018.
